page.title: 01LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: This area is the north west part of the Lizard peninsula. Most of the area is undulating open farmland with patches of trees in the small valleys.To the east there is the Royal Naval Air Station of Culdrose,the largest helicoptor base in Europe.To the north there is the southern part of the ancient town of Helston,the older streets surrounded by newer housing estates.These estates were built for families of Culdrose personnel. Southwest of Helston is Loe Pool,Cornwalls biggest natural freshwater lake,a place of great beauty and legend. This is a densely wooded area with Degibna Woods to the east of the pool and Penrose Estate on the west bank.This is a superb place for walks and picnics.
